channel.title: BBC News - Family & Education

item.title: Covid: Single jab recommended for 12 to 15-year-olds by UK's top doctors
item.description: Move will help reduce school disruption, top doctors say, with decision now in hands of ministers.

item.title: Covid: Colchester Institute students board bus to get jabbed
item.description: A vaccination bus is on campus to give teenagers a chance to get jabbed.

item.title: Warning on teachers' lack of Holocaust knowledge
item.description: Many teachers do not know enough about the Holocaust to combat myths and falsehoods, a study suggests.

item.title: Universities told to give students face-to-face teaching
item.description: Education Secretary Gavin Williamson says students should expect in-person teaching for new term.

item.title: Hertfordshire University students sign petition against online learning
item.description: More than 400 students sign a petition demanding in-person teaching at Hertfordshire University.

item.title: University of Portsmouth plans new campus in London
item.description: If it goes ahead, the campus in Waltham Forest in north-east London could open by 2023.

item.title: Anger over Queen's Uni's withdrawal of halls offer
item.description: Eóin Deery and Pádraig Muldoon had paid a deposit and been due to get the keys this week.

item.title: Global Teacher Prize: Two teachers in England up for $1m award
item.description: Teachers from Liverpool and Sevenoaks are in the last 50 in the hunt for the world's best teacher.

item.title: Williamson admits mistake over Rashford-Itoje mix-up
item.description: Education Secretary Gavin Williamson confuses the England footballer and rugby player in an interview.

item.title: Special-needs support beyond crisis, heads say
item.description: Funding has to rise so all pupils can be supported to learn, the National Association of Head Teachers says.

item.title: Record numbers of UK students head for university
item.description: More UK students have accepted uni places this year but EU student numbers fall sharply.

item.title: N.Ireland assembly recalled over school Covid absences
item.description: There is concern the test and trace policy is causing a high number of pupils to miss classes.

item.title: Millions of pupils return to school amid Covid spike concern
item.description: Schools have welcomed back millions of pupils in England and Wales as the new term begins.

item.title: N. Ireland school has half pupils off as close contacts
item.description: At least 400 pupils from Larne High School in County Antrim could not come to class on Monday.

item.title: Students return with school restrictions lifted
item.description: Students across the UK are returning to school after the summer break and and a year disrupted by Covid.

item.title: Some N.Ireland schools 'not following contact advice'
item.description: A teachers' organisation says there are concerns the guidance could lead to more Covid cases.

item.title: Reports of sex abuse between children double in two years
item.description: Reports of children sexually abusing other children double in two years, BBC Panorama finds.

item.title: Covid-19: Decision on jabs for children due in days
item.description: There is a "strong case" for vaccinating healthy 12 to 15-year-olds, the government believes.

item.title: Covid: What do parents think about vaccinating children?
item.description: Parents share their thoughts on the prospect of offering Covid vaccines to all 12 to 15-year-olds.

item.title: Covid: Schools aren't infection hubs, says public health boss
item.description: Dr Yvonne Doyle seeks to reassure parents as pupils head back to classrooms across the country.

item.title: School funding warning as pupils return to class in England
item.description: As pupils return to class in England, there's a warning that more money is needed to help pupils catch up.

item.title: Thousands of pupils return to NI schools
item.description: The new academic year begins, with 350,000 children and young people going back to classrooms.

item.title: Covid: High virus levels 'highly likely' in schools
item.description: Scientific advisers say government should plan for this happening by the end of September in England.

item.title: Five things to take to university - and one to avoid
item.description: Brighten up your accommodation, make friends and cook nicer meals with these handy items.

item.title: The Kenyans who are helping the world to cheat
item.description: Some Kenyans try to escape poverty by helping foreign students to fake their academic work.

item.title: Covid: Will I need a jab and what will university be like this term?
item.description: Many Covid restrictions have been lifted for students going to university this term.

item.title: Covid: Mixed emotions as pupils return to school across England
item.description: Parents have contrasting feelings as safety measures in schools are eased at the start of the new year.

item.title: Exams 2021: 'Will they take our Covid grades seriously?'
item.description: It's been a stressful few months for the thousands of young people waiting for their exam results.

item.title: GCSE results 2021: How were grades decided?
item.description: Teachers have decided their pupils' grades after Covid cancelled exams for a second year.

item.title: GCSEs 2021: The 9-1 grading system explained
item.description: Teenagers will receive their GCSE results on 12 August.

item.title: Parents' fears over sexting and abuse among teenagers
item.description: A mother and a father reveal their shock at learning of their children's experiences of online sex.

item.title: Zoomtown-on-Sea? The lure of a new life on the coast
item.description: Remote working meant the Lancaster family could live anywhere - they found their sea view in Scarborough.

item.title: 'I thought rape isn't something that happens to men'
item.description: Support charities say male victims of sexual assault sometimes feel their experiences don't count.

item.title: Will my child get free school meals this summer?
item.description: A year on from Marcus Rashford's successful campaign, what is the current situation?

item.title: Students: ‘Uni definitely not good value this year’
item.description: Students are angry at paying full fees with so little in-person teaching, says report.

item.title: Self-isolating students in end-of-tenancy 'nightmare'
item.description: What happens if a housemate tests positive for Covid just as you were about to move out?

item.title: Poorer white pupils 'let down and neglected'
item.description: White pupils from low income families are falling behind "every step of the way", an education committee says.

item.title: Covid-19: School proms hit by continuing lockdown restrictions
item.description: Pupils' plans to celebrate with their friends have been hit by continuing lockdown restrictions.

item.title: Child labour in Uganda: The hidden costs of Covid
item.description: When all Uganda's schools closed due to the pandemic, nine-year-old Teddy joined her mother mining for gold.

item.title: Should schoolchildren still have to self-isolate?
item.description: More than a quarter of a million children are absent from school in the UK because of coronavirus.

item.title: Contaminated blood inquiry: The school where dozens of pupils died
item.description: Ex-pupils caught up in the infected blood scandal decades ago are giving evidence at an inquiry.

item.title: 'I play all the instruments in my Irish music band'
item.description: Caitríona Lagan is a 15-year-old All-Ireland champion musician who plays five instruments.

item.title: Back to school: How are pupils being kept Covid-safe?
item.description: Many children are returning to school after the holidays, while Scottish pupils already returned.

item.title: Covid Q&A: What are the rules for schools in Wales?
item.description: New Welsh government rules are expected to be adopted by schools by 20 September at the latest.

item.title: Back to school: Parents and pupils delighted at return
item.description: As the first schools in England start back, the BBC asks if this is a return to normal.

item.title: When do pupils in Scotland have to self-isolate?
item.description: With the virus surging, we re-examine the new isolation rules and ask whether schools can ask pupils to stay at home.

item.title: Welsh schools to get £6m anti-Covid air technology
item.description: Schools, colleges and universities in Wales are promised air monitors and ozone disinfecting machines.

item.title: Affordable uniforms law will miss new school year
item.description: Parents are concerned that a law to make school uniforms cheaper will not be in place for September.

item.title: 'Only way you'll get to Oxford is on a bus'
item.description: Social mobility campaigner Sir Peter Lampl worries about the lack of fair opportunity for young people.

item.title: Williamson wants to scrap bubbles to keep pupils in school
item.description: With more pupils sent home from school in England, there are calls for a different approach to Covid cases.

item.title: More pupils sent home as Covid disruption soars
item.description: Rapid increase in pupils out of school in England as changes expected for self-isolation rules.

item.title: Free school lunches for all children in P4 and P5 in Scotland
item.description: All pupils in P4 will be entitled to a school meal from August, while P5s will be offered lunches by January.

item.title: School catch-up tsar resigns over lack of funding
item.description: England's school recovery commissioner Sir Kevan Collins quits, saying the funding "falls far short".

item.title: Boris Johnson promises more school catch-up cash in 'damp squib' row
item.description: Boris Johnson defends £1.4bn tutoring school catch-up plan after heads left "hugely disappointed".

item.title: Face masks no longer required in classrooms
item.description: Face coverings will not be needed in England's secondary classrooms from 17 May, says the prime minister.

item.title: Covid: Poor pupils fall further behind in maths
item.description: The gap between poor pupils and their classmates is unlikely to narrow without intervention, researchers say.

item.title: A-level results 2021: Top grades reach record high
item.description: The second year of results after cancelled exams sees the highest level of A* and A grades at A-level.

item.title: A-levels: Warning over private and state school gap
item.description: The former school recovery tsar warns of growing educational inequality as a result of the pandemic.

item.title: Sexual assault claims 'mishandled' by universities
item.description: A letter signed by women from 15 universities calls for a compulsory policy for sex assault claims.

item.title: A-Level results: Hackney twins head to Oxbridge with six A*s
item.description: Twin brothers from east London gain places at Oxford and Cambridge after achieving top A-level grades.

item.title: University clearing may be 'much more competitive' this year - Ucas boss
item.description: "It's still a good year for clearing," says the admissions service boss, ahead of results day next week.

item.title: Lectures staying online into autumn term
item.description: A student petition calls it "ridiculous" as some UK universities keep lectures online for next term.

item.title: Covid vaccine will not be compulsory for university lectures
item.description: Ministers are no longer considering making two doses mandatory for students in England, the BBC learns.

item.title: Exams likely to face more changes in 2022
item.description: Gavin Williamson says 2022 A-levels and GCSEs in England are likely to be modified for lost lessons.

item.title: Scottish exams body to be reformed amid grades row
item.description: The announcement comes amid criticism of the SQA over plans put in place to replace school exams this year.
